intro: Phyteuma cordatum, commonly known as the heartleaf phyteuma, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Phyteuma cordatum is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ease of care.
